conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and projection.
Initial image shows light source casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Movement of light source changes angle of light rays relative to objects and ground.
Location of shadows will shift closer to objects as light source moves backward.
Size of shadows will become smaller as light source moves backward.
Shadow A will move closer to the birdcage and become smaller.
Shadow B will move closer to the object casting it and become smaller.
Shadow C will move closer to the object casting it and become smaller.
Shadow D will move closer to the cross and become smaller.
Shadows move closer to their respective objects and become smaller when light source moves backwards.
